name: Y Combinator (YC)
description: An American seed money startup accelerator that has been used to launch over 2,000 companies, including Dropbox, Airbnb, Stripe, and Reddit.

name: Politicians
description: Individuals involved in politics who sometimes argue that the only way to become a billionaire is by exploiting people.

name: Founders
description: Individuals who start and build startups and seek funding from accelerators like Y Combinator.

name: YC Partners
description: Individuals who work at Y Combinator and are responsible for deciding which startups to fund.

name: Y Combinator Motto
description: 'Make something people want.'

name: YC partners
description: Partners at Y Combinator who evaluate potential startups.

name: Boom
description: A company mentioned as an example of one with an obvious path to a huge market.

name: Apple
description: An example of a successful company that started with a larval market in personal computers.
The year Apple was founded.

name: Steve Wozniak
description: Co-founder of Apple who wanted a computer.

name: Mark Zuckerberg
description: Founder of Facebook who wanted to engage online with college friends.

name: Larry Page
description: Co-founder of Google who wanted to find things on the web.

name: Sergey Brin
description: Co-founder of Google who wanted to find things on the web.

name: international airlines
description: Potential customers for Boom's airliner.

name: larval market
description: A small but growable market that eventually leads to a huge market.

name: Airbnb
description: A successful startup that provides an online marketplace for lodging, primarily homestays for vacation rentals, and tourism activities.
